intro: Acinodendron floribundum, commonly known as the clustered-flowered acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Acinodendron floribundum is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
